header.title: A True & Faithful Relation of What passed for many Yeers Between Dr. John Dee And Some Spirits

central_thesis: The central thesis of 'A True & Faithful Relation' is that Dr. John Dee, with the aid of his scryer Edward Kelley, received direct, divine revelations from various spirits and angels. These communications purported to convey a comprehensive system of angelic magic, including a unique language (Enochian), a cosmology, and instructions for a 'General Alteration of most STATES and KINGDOMS in the World', suggesting a divinely sanctioned plan for global transformation and the restoration of ancient wisdom.

structure_content.summary: Casaubon's extensive preface serves as a critical introduction, framing Dee's work within a historical context of figures interacting with spirits, from ancient philosophers to Mahomet and Paracelsus. He grapples with the authenticity and moral implications of Dee's angelic conversations, offering a cautious, often skeptical, yet academically thorough analysis. This section sets the tone for the entire work, acknowledging its controversial nature and its claims of divine inspiration.

This section chronicles the initial contacts between Dee, Kelley, and various spirits/angels. It details the revelation and construction of the foundational instruments for communication: the Holy Table of Practice and the elaborate Sigillum Dei Aemeth. The early sessions establish the ceremonial protocols, the role of Edward Kelley as the primary scryer, and Dee's role as the meticulous scribe and interrogator, laying the groundwork for the more complex revelations that follow.

This period marks the most significant phase of the angelic communications, focusing on the dictation of the Angelic or Enochian language. It includes the revelation of the Enochian alphabet, its vocabulary, grammar, and the 48 Claves Angelicae (Angelic Keys or Calls). The angels also reveal the system of 30 Aethyrs (or Airs), which constitute a hierarchical cosmological map. This system is presented as a direct, divinely given means to access profound spiritual knowledge and effect change.

The narratives from this period illustrate attempts to apply the angelic revelations to practical, worldly affairs. Dee and Kelley engage in political prognostication, seek alchemical secrets (like the Philosopher's Stone), and travel across Europe attempting to influence powerful figures. This section also covers intense personal challenges and controversies, most notably the 'Cross-Pact' incident where Dee and Kelley exchanged wives, an event that deeply divided their household and has been a source of much debate regarding the nature of the spirits and Kelley's motivations.

Following Kelley's eventual departure from Dee, the later entries detail Dee's continued, though less successful, attempts at angelic communication with other scryers. These sessions are fewer, often fragmented, and lack the depth and scope of the earlier work with Kelley. This final section reflects on the diminishing returns of the angelic work, its unfulfilled prophecies, and Dee's enduring conviction in the divine origin of the revelations despite the setbacks and personal hardships.

key_concepts.definition: A sacred, usually square or rectangular table, upon which the Shew-stone and the Sigillum Dei Aemeth are placed during scrying sessions. It is carefully constructed and adorned with specific divine and angelic names, geometric figures, and elemental squares, acting as the primary altar and focal point for angelic communication.

The 'Seal of God's Truth', a complex wax or metallic disc with intricate geometric and numerological patterns, inscribed with divine names, planetary symbols, and angelic names. Seven such seals were created, one placed under the Shew-stone and one under each leg of the Table of Practice, believed to facilitate and protect angelic contact.

The divinatory medium (typically a crystal globe or obsidian mirror) through which Edward Kelley (and other scryers) perceived visions of angels and received audible messages, which Dee then transcribed. It is the 'window' into the angelic realms.

A purportedly divine language revealed by angels, possessing its own unique alphabet, grammar, and vocabulary. It is the language in which the 'Calls' or 'Keys' are written and spoken, believed to be the true primal language that can directly influence spiritual realities.

A series of 48 poetic invocations or 'Keys' dictated in the Enochian language. These Calls are designed to 'open' the various 'Aethyrs' or cosmological regions, thereby invoking specific angelic hierarchies and accessing their knowledge and power. Each Call is associated with particular themes and angelic intelligences.

30 hierarchical cosmological divisions or 'Airs' revealed within the Enochian system. Each Aethyr represents a distinct layer of reality, progressively more subtle, and is populated by specific angelic beings. Traversing these Aethyrs through the Enochian Calls is central to accessing the full scope of angelic wisdom and power.

key_concepts.term: General Alteration of States and Kingdoms
key_concepts.definition: The overarching, divinely-declared purpose of the entire angelic operation. Dee believed the angelic system was revealed to provide humanity with the knowledge and power necessary to bring about a radical spiritual, political, and social reformation across the world, restoring a golden age under divine guidance.

practical_system.description: The practical system detailed in 'A True & Faithful Relation' is a highly structured form of theurgic invocation and divine revelation, centered on ceremonial scrying. Its core aim is to establish and maintain direct communication with various angelic intelligences to acquire profound wisdom, including a new language (Enochian), a detailed cosmology, and instructions for initiating a 'General Alteration' of the world. The system emphasizes purity, piety, and adherence to precise ritual protocols as revealed by the angels themselves. It functions through a dual partnership: the Magus (Dee) as the interrogator and transcriber, and the Scryer (Kelley) as the medium for perceiving and vocalizing angelic messages.
tools: Shew-stone (crystal or obsidian sphere/mirror) for visual and auditory communication.
Holy Table of Practice (a wooden table of specific dimensions, consecrated, and inscribed with divine names, sigils, and elemental squares).
Sigillum Dei Aemeth (seven wax seals placed on and beneath the Holy Table).
Scribe's pen, ink, and paper for precise recording of all angelic dialogues and revelations.
Rings (possibly worn by Dee and Kelley, though their specific role in every ritual is not always detailed).
Enochian Tablets (Watchtowers or Elemental Tablets), complex magical squares derived from angelic dictation, used for invoking specific elemental and directional intelligences.
rituals: Consecration and preparation of the Holy Table of Practice, involving specific prayers, geometric designs, and the arrangement of divine names.
Creation and placement of the Sigillum Dei Aemeth, a complex wax or metallic seal placed beneath the Shew-stone and the table legs, imbued with divine and angelic energies.
Ritual purification and prayer by both the Magus and Scryer to ensure spiritual readiness and protection.
Formal invocations and prayers uttered by the Magus to call forth specific angels to appear in the Shew-stone, later evolving into the use of the Enochian Calls/Keys.

Scrying sessions, during which the Scryer enters a receptive state, perceives angelic figures and messages within the Shew-stone, and relays them verbally to the Magus for meticulous transcription. This includes dialogues, dictates of the Enochian language, and descriptions of angelic visions.
Drawing and arrangement of elemental tablets (Watchtowers) based on angelic instruction, which later become integral to advanced Enochian invocations.

Performance of the 48 Enochian Calls in their specific linguistic and numerical sequence to 'open' and access the 30 Aethyrs, each call corresponding to a particular angelic hierarchy and realm of knowledge.

critical_analysis.relevance: A True & Faithful Relation is a foundational and indispensable text for understanding Western Esotericism, particularly the development of Enochian magic. It offers an unparalleled primary source account of ritual magic, divine revelation, and angelic communication during the late Renaissance. Its detailed descriptions of angelic cosmology, the Enochian language, and ceremonial practices have profoundly influenced subsequent occult traditions, including the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn, Thelema, and various modern magical currents. It remains a key document for scholars of the history of science, religion, and the occult, providing insights into the blurred lines between these disciplines in the early modern period. The psychological and spiritual dimensions of the Dee-Kelley relationship, as recorded, also continue to be a subject of intense academic and practical scrutiny.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Scholars of Western Esotericism, historians of Renaissance science and religion, practitioners of ceremonial magic (especially Enochian magic), researchers into altered states of consciousness and channeling phenomena, and individuals interested in the historical development of occult philosophy and practices.
